content: Hello ! I cannot try what might be the best way to display a type without type parameters. Let me explain. I have a type Vec<u8> and instead of displaying Vec<u8> I want to display only Vec . Is there a way to do this easily and in a proper way ?
Can't find any reference to this function in ra codebase
To add more context, the idea is to be able to automatically generate Vec::default() from an assist and not Vec<u8>::default() which is currently wrong
why not just add two colons to make it turbofish syntax?
It wouldn't be very idiomatic in my case. It's to implement https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/11145#issuecomment-1004215290
you can do hir_ty.as_adt() and then get the name from that
(obviously only handles ADTs but that should cover everything for the Foo::default() case I believe)
